question: In the situation shown in the diagram, magnitude of <katex>$q\ll|Q|$</katex> and <katex>$r>>a$</katex>. The net force on the free charge -q and net torque on it about O at the instant shown are respectively [p=2aQ is the dipole moment]
images/question_44.png
explanation: The arrangement is a dipole (-Q, +Q) with moment <katex>$\vec{p} = 2aQ \hat{i}$</katex>. The charge -q is on the equatorial line at distance r.
Electric field on equatorial line <katex>$\vec{E}_{eq} = -\frac{kp}{r^3}$</katex> (opposite to p). So <katex>$\vec{E} = -\frac{kp}{r^3}\hat{i}$</katex>.
Force on -q is <katex>$\vec{F} = (-q)\vec{E} = (-q)(-\frac{kp}{r^3}\hat{i}) = \frac{kpq}{r^3}\hat{i}$</katex>. (Matches first term of C).
Torque about O: Force is in +x direction. Position vector is <katex>$\vec{r} = r\hat{j}$</katex>. <katex>$\vec{\tau} = \vec{r} \times \vec{F} = (r\hat{j}) \times (F\hat{i}) = -rF \hat{k}$</katex>.
